comments: Summation of n^2 taken 4 at a time. - Al Hakanson (hawkuu(AT)gmail.com), May 20 2009
links: P. De Geest, Palindromic Sums of Squares of Consecutive Integers
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (3,-3,1).
Index entries for two-way infinite sequences
formula: a(n) = 4*n^2 + 12*n + 14. - Al Hakanson (hawkuu(AT)gmail.com), May 20 2009a(n) = a(n-1)+8*(n+1) for n>0, a(0)=14. - _Vincenzo Librandi_, Nov 19 2010G.f.: 2*(7-6*x+3*x^2)/(1-x)^3. - _Colin Barker_, Feb 17 2012From _Jean-Christophe Herv√©_, Nov 11 2015: (Start)a(n) = (2*n+3)^2 + 5 = A016754(n+1) + 5, hence a(n) is never square.a(n) is defined for n < 0 and a(-n) = a(n-3) for any n.(End)
mathematica: f[n_]:=(n^2+(n+2)^2+(n+4)^2+(n+6)^2)/4;Table[f[n],{n,0,6!,2}] (* _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Mar 03 2010 *)Table[n^2 + (n + 1)^2 + (n + 2)^2 + (n + 3)^2, {n, 0, 42}] (* _Alonso del Arte_, Feb 17 2012 *)
prog: (Sage) [i^2+(i+1)^2+(i+2)^2+(i+3)^2 for i in xrange(0,50)] # _Zerinvary Lajos_, Jul 03 2008(PARI) vector(100, n, n--; n^2+(n+1)^2+(n+2)^2+(n+3)^2) \\ _Altug Alkan_, Nov 11 2015
author: _Patrick De Geest_
